intro: Aegilops erigens, commonly known as the slender wild rye, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Europe. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, which are typically wind-pollinated. Aegilops erigens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has been studied for its potential agricultural uses and genetic contributions to wheat species.
